import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
plt.style.use('ggplot')
import re
import string
from wordcloud import WordCloud, STOPWORDS

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.d5116438:
def generate_wordcloud(column, stopwords):
    wordcloud = WordCloud(width = 1000, height = 1000, 
                background_color ='white',  
                stopwords = stopwords,
                min_font_size = 10).generate(str(df[column]))
    return wordcloud
    
def plot_wordcloud(wordcloud):
    plt.imshow(wordcloud)
    plt.axis('off')
    plt.tight_layout(pad = 0)
    plt.show()

df[['Job Description', 'Company Name']]

source.17da4288:
new_stopwords = list(STOPWORDS) + ['Fanduel', 'group'] #stopwords is imported as a set. need to transform to a list in order to make it mutable
clean_cloud = generate_wordcloud('Job Description', new_stopwords)
plot_wordcloud(clean_cloud)

source.c3c17964: **In this particular data set when can see that New York City has significantly more openings for Data Analysts than any other city**
source.4375be3b: There is only one instance of missing data in this dataset so we will simply ignore it for this analysis
source.5e9df6e8: Largest words are mostly what we would expect.  Although two words standout a little unexpectadely. 'FanDuel' and 'Group'.  The former which is a company name and the latter which can is generally used in a compnay name. Coincidentally they are used together and frequently in FanDuel's job description which is causing the large representatoin in the word cloud.  We can add those to the set of stop words as to ignore them
source.545170e0:
1) Job Desciption is writing in paragraphs with new lines inside each record. The new line gets interpreted with the raw '\n' syntax so will be removed

2) Company name includes not only the name but the company rating as well. The rating is already a column so it can br removed from this column
source.ce276207: # **What are the most common words used in data analyst job descriptions?**
